options.text: In capping, methyl guanosine triphosphate is added to the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>3</mn><mo>'</mo></math> end of hnRNA.
RNA polymerase binds with Rho factor to terminate the process of transcription in bacteria.
The coding strand in a transcription unit is copied to an mRNA.
Split gene arrangement is characteristic of prokaryotes.

solution.text:
The termination of transcription is either (a) Rho-dependent or (b) Rho-independent. The rho-protein binds to a specific sequence of DNA and terminates the RNA transcription.
  • The capping is the addition of 7-methyl guanosine (an unusual base) to the 5' end of hnRNA.
  • Split genes are characteristic features of eukaryotes and not prokaryotes.
  • The coding strand is also called the antisense strand and this is not transcribed during the transcription process.
